IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Project Narrative Non-pharmacological strategies to increase the healthspan and physical functioning of PWH are urgently needed. Our study examines how two promising strategies, habitual physical activity and dietary intake, are associated with sarcopenia in a population at high risk for developing this debilitating musculoskeletal disease. These strategies can be incorporated into ongoing health promotion initiatives in clinics nationwide to help PWH age well.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative / Public Health Statement The proposed research is relevant to public health because Lyme disease, an infection caused by bacteria from the genus Borrelia, is endemic in the US and continues to spread. The objective of this project is to develop a vaccine against Borrelia species by combining peptides based on outer-membrane proteins expressed in various phases of B. burgdorferi infectious cycle with novel adjuvants. Therefore, this project is relevant to the part of NIH’s mission regarding enhancing health, lengthening life, and reducing illness.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Brain organoids are an increasingly popular platform for neuroscientific research, yet their macroscopic size (1-3 mm) prevents current high-content optical microscopes from offering an effective means to rapidly image large specimen collections for longitudinal assessment. In this project, Ramona Optics and the Stein Lab at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill will develop and test a parallelized, 96-camera 3D microscope and associated software to rapidly capture (< 10 sec.) the 3D morphology and volume of in vitro brain organoids within full 96 well plates. This new technology aims to drive efficiency and novel bioassay development by delivering 3D volume, surface area and morphology measurements that correlate with current standards by >95% while maintaining a 100X speed-up for experimental workflow.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Group 3 pulmonary hypertension with associated interstitial lung disease is a devastating condition with a single therapeutic option. Cutting-edge research has identified a pharmacologic inhibitor of hyaluronan production which dramatically improves outcomes in pre-clinical disease models. This project will deliver a proprietary formulation of this inhibitor, ready for clinical development as a first-in-class disease-modifying agent.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Given the enormous cost of bringing new drugs to market, and the many challenges associated with evaluating drug candidates using in vitro and animal models, there is much interest in leveraging stem cells to produce organoid models of various human organ systems for drug screening. A key component of this effort is mimicking the mass transport and microenvironmental properties of natural tissues and capillaries. This study will prototype and validate a versatile, programmable microfluidic organ-on-chip bioreactor platform for perfusion culture and drug screening with vascularized cardiac organoids, leveraging a low cost electronic automation manifold and SBS-format injection-molded microfluidic consumables.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Narrative Radiation therapy is often a lifesaving treatment for pediatric brain tumor patients, but simultanously may cause radiation toxicity to surrounding healthy tissues in the brain. Mitigating tissue damage is necessary in order to avoid long-term developmental side effects to these children; our ClickBrain RT software will use deep learning technologies to automatically delineate key structures in the brain and predict volumetric changes that occur due to treatment-related radiation dosing to these key structures. This will help physicians to better avoid unnecessary radiation doses that may cause long-term deficits in children with brain tumors and can ultimately lead to better quality of life for these children.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DENTAL & CRANIOFACIAL RESEARCH
PHR: NARRATIVE Wound healing complications occur following cleft palate repair and wisdom teeth removal at rates of about 60% and 25%, respectively. Oral cavity trauma after injury or cancer surgery can also lead to wound healing problems. Such complications can lead to poor feeding, speech problems, prolonged recovery and, ultimately, revision surgery. During this project we will test a therapy to promote more rapid and complete wound healing.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative  Respiratory disorders such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and asthma are among the leading causes of disability and death globally, which are currently widely underdiagnosed, undertreated, and often undermanaged over time. In this project, we will develop an easy-to-use smart wearable lung monitor based on a proprietary contact microphone technology to enable extended monitoring and analysis of lung sounds and breathing function with a higher sensitivity than medical-grade digital stethoscopes and in a significantly smaller form-factor. The wearable patch developed in this project aims to help with remote monitoring of patients outside of the hospital, facilitating early diagnosis, and reducing the risks and cost associated with management of respiratory diseases.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Human T cell leukemia virus type-1 (HTLV-1) is a human retrovirus that is the causative agent of a malignant T CD4+ cell lymphoproliferative disorder referred to as adult T cell leukemia/lymphoma (ATLL), as well as several inflammatory disorders with the most problematic being HTLV-1 associated myelopathy/tropical spastic paraparesis (HAM/TSP). Remarkable, while millions are affected worldwide, there is no effective vaccine or treatment options to prevent ATLL or HAM/TSP afflicted individuals. We thus aim here, to develop a candidate immunotherapeutic vaccine to prevent and plausibly treat HTLV1-associated disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: Project Narrative Proper spindle positioning and establishment of the cell division plane is critical for tissue morphogenesis, cell fate specification, and development, and varies among symmetric and asymmetric divisions. While the machinery responsible for anchoring and moving the spindle is well-characterized, many features of its dynamic regulation are poorly understood. I seek to characterize how such features work and how they make flexible control of spindle positioning possible.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AT ANN ARBOR
PHR: Project Narrative Single cell mRNA sequencing (scRNAseq) data previously generated from the human fetal intestine indicates that one of the potential intestinal epithelial niche-supporting populations of the intestinal mesenchyme is the sub-epithelial cells (SECs). This mesenchymal sub-population is located immediately adjacent to the intestinal epithelium, can be defined by PDGFRahi/F3+ gene expression, and was recently determined to not be a homogenous population; but rather there are distinct, mutually exclusive identities localized to the crypt and villus SECs (Holloway, 2021). This proposal aims to use iPSC-derived HIO cultures to 1) interrogate the role of crypt-based SECs as a potential source of niche signaling and 2) to investigate the role of HGF signaling in maintenance of the intestinal stem cells (ISCs).

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Cystic fibrosis (CF) affects more than 100,000 people worldwide and causes the formation of thick mucus in the lungs, leading to the chronic infection of various pathogens that are prone to developing antibiotic tolerance. This application proposes that preexposure to bacterial extracellular vesicles leads to epigenetic changes in host bronchial epithelial cells that alter the host immune response, contributing to the establishment of chronic lung infections. The project will serve as a foundation for the candidate to develop skills as an academic researcher and could lead to the development of novel therapeutic treatments for CF.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON MINORITY HEALTH AND HEALTH DISPARITIES
PHR: Women in the U.S. are twice as likely to die from maternal complications when compared to other high-income countries, and over half of maternal deaths in the U.S. occur postpartum. Many Black Indigenous and People of Color (BIPOC) women receive support from doulas and midwives (birth workers) during birth and for one week after birth. Community health workers are in an ideal position to support women postpartum during a time when women no longer receive support from birth workers. KDHRC's proposed program, Effective Newborn Community-Outreach Recovery Engagement (ENCORE), will train community health workers to support postpartum BIPOC women through outreach that builds knowledge and skills to support postpartum BIPOC women, particularly women who no longer receive support from birth workers, improving postpartum outcomes and reducing postpartum health disparities.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
PHR: Public Health Relevance Infertility affects 1 in 8 couples in the United States and ~40% is due to a male cause. Current semen analysis only counts sperm number, assess the morphology and motility, this does not provide information on a sperm's ability to actually fertilize an oocyte. It is widely accepted that if a sperm looks normal, is motile, and there are many of them in a sample, then a male is likely fertile; but this assumption is flawed as many men have normal semen parameters yet are infertile. At PS Fertility we are marketing a Synthetic Egg:Sperm Fusion Assay (SEFA) a diagnostic test that will assess the ability of the sperm to fuse/fertilize an oocyte.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative It has long been observed that disease severity and outcomes are different in males and females, yet we don’t know why. The goal of my proposed project is to answer this question by looking at differences in T cell metabolism between males and females, and how they relate to viral infection outcomes. Understanding the biology of sex differences in T cells, metabolism, and infection will offer context to sex differences in immunity as well as new sex-specific therapies for infection.

PHR: The research supports development of technology that allows ordinary mobile phones to be used to detect preeclampsia and hypertension in patients remotely. IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SCIENCES
ORG_NAME: NEW YORK UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
PHR: Project narrative  This project aims to 1) evaluate the role of metals and metal mixtures in the risk of coronary heart disease (CHD); 2) to assess the genetic susceptibility to the effect of metals and metal mixtures on the risk of CHD; and 3) to identify the potential urinary metabolites that are associated with both CHD risk and metals/metal mixtures. We will pool data from three prospective cohorts consisting of diverse populations. This study can provide insight into the relationship between metal exposures and CHD risk, with implications for preventing and controlling exposures in the US and abroad.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Sostos, LLC is developing an assay that addresses the high incidence of tumor recurrence in patients with non- small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) at the time of primary tumor surgical resection. Our technology identifies NSCLC as at high risk of progression and recurrence of cancer for patients who will benefit from earlier therapeutic intervention. Using qRT-PCR of formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumors, we anticipate that our product will become part of the standard of care for early-stage NSCLC patients, at the time of surgical resection of the primary tumor, for identifying those at high-risk who would benefit from early implementation of adjuvant therapy to prevent tumor progression and recurrence – years before otherwise identified – and thus, improving overall patient care and outcome for those with lung cancer.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE PARMedics is developing a PAR2 biased antagonist, C781, that can reduce airway inflammation and bronchoconstriction. Results from Phase I indicate that C781 may be effective in combating acute allergen- induced asthma exacerbations as well as the underlying pathology, through reducing the cytokine production and cellular infiltration associated with chronic disease. In this SBIR Phase II, PARMedics will further develop C781 as a new class of therapeutics for asthma and other inflammatory lung diseases through relevant IND- enabling preclinical asthma models.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative Chromatin architecture is intimately connected to gene regulation and its disruption can cause a wide range of diseases. I propose to investigate how Ldb1 (an understudied architectural factor) establishes lineage-specific gene expression programs in the context of erythroid maturation and during cell cycle progression. This work will improve our understanding of normal development and provide insights into how perturbations in chromatin architecture can lead to gene dysregulation in disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CENTER FOR ADVANCING TRANSLATIONAL SCIENCES
PHR: Project Narrative  Liver-directed gene therapies using adeno-associated virus vectors have shown tremendous promise but lack safe, efficient, and economical means of delivery. This project aims to create a specialized gene therapy medical device, the Gene Therapy Catheter, which combines several mechanisms for increasing the uptake of adeno-associated viral vector into one novel device. Based on preliminary data, we estimate that the Gene Therapy Catheter will be able to reduce the cost and volume of adeno-associated viral vector required by 90% compared to systemic delivery.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Narrative Plasmodium falciparum is the most fatal species among the malaria protozoan parasites infecting humans, resulting in over 400,000 deaths annually, mostly among children living in malaria endemic regions. While approval of the first malaria vaccine was a monumental milestone, its efficacy is limited, providing partial protection in children with only ~30% efficacy. Versatope’s platform has the potential to provide a thermostable vaccine with improved immunogenicity that acts as both a pre-erythrocytic and transmission blocking vaccine, effectively reducing incidence and mortality among this vulnerable population.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative This proposal examines a novel approach to cholesterol removalthrough use of proprietary nanodiscs in the eye to treat dry age-related macular degeneration, the leading cause of blindness among people over age 50 years in the United States. The approach will first systematically generate the optimal nanodisc for cholesterol removal and then test efficacy in relevant cellular and pre-clinical models. Led by experts in lipids, eye disease, and nanodiscs, completion of these studies will validate cholesterol removal as a treatment strategy for dry age- related macular degeneration.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative In the normal epidermis, ultraviolet radiation exposure induces the protective tanning response which transiently upregulates keratinocyte to melanocyte crosstalk. Melanoma cells hijack the protective tanning response, forcing keratinocytes to release factors that enrich for or stimulate the emergence of stem-like properties in melanoma cells. This project will investigate the mechanism by which melanoma cells activate pro- melanomagenic signaling in keratinocytes and the extent to which that signaling enhances melanoma migration, invasion and drug resistance.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative Gastrointestinal disorders, such as celiac disease, are a significant global health challenge due to their dramatically increasing prevalence in the general USA population resulting in excessive health care costs. In this study, a non-pathogenic gut protist is used as a method to increase oral tolerance to gluten, hence reducing the negative inflammatory reactions that lead to the onset of celiac disease. This novel concept aims to benefit human health as the identified protist-immune regulatory mechanisms are likely to provide new protist-based therapeutic interventions to prevent and revert celiac disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: NARRATIVE DoK-7 congenital myasthenic syndrome is an orphan rare neuromuscular disorder associated with limb-girdle pattern of weakness, choking spells, respiratory insufficiency, and severe scoliosis. AMP-101 is a gene therapy product with demonstrated efficacy in pre-clinical models of the disease and clean toxicology profile at 29 and 183 days which will be able to shift current clinical practice from chronic administration of drugs to alleviate symptoms to a one-off treatment, administered through a single intravenous injection. The project will complete AMP-101 development including GLP manufacturing and clinical assays to detect cellular immune responses against viral antigens and viral shedding ensuring smooth transition to the clinic.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Mild Cognitive Impairment, associated with memory loss and changes in cognitive function, is one of the earliest symptoms of Alzheimer’s Disease (MCI-AD). Botanical natural products (NPs) have shown to improve cognition in AD patients, however incomplete descriptions of molecular targets, mechanisms, and appropriate brain exposure have limited their development for MCI-AD. Sensorium Therapeutics is developing their Biodynamic Discovery Platform (BDP) to identify and develop psychoactive natural products to treat AD by delaying MCI onset after the earliest signals of pathology can be detected.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: ImmunoPET has proven to be a groundbreaking innovation yielding actionable medical information that is not otherwise obtainable in many disease areas. This project will enable nationwide availability of ImmunoPET by delivering the first-ever fully-automated production platform that can support a wide diversity of ImmunoPET tracers. HIV ImmunoPET was chosen for demonstration of this enabling platform due to the value of the imaging information coupled with it currently being limited to a single US site.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Microinjection, which entails using a microcapillary needle to deliver foreign substances (e.g., e.g., nucleic acids, proteins, viruses, cells, and nanoparticles) into biological targets (e.g., cells, embryos, and tissues), is widely used for research and clinical applications ranging from animal-based genetic experimentation to fertility treatments, genetic diagnoses, and disease prevention modeling in humans. This proposal will evaluate the utility and performance of novel mechanically robust 3D-printed microcapillary needles compared to the current industry standard needles. This pending-patent direct laser writing design has the potential to simultaneously address customer pain points and bridge an important need in the microinjection industry.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Obesity phenotypes, characterized by abnormalities in the components of food intake, such as abnormal postprandial satiety, may be useful to guide selection of lifestyle interventions, anti-obesity medications and endoscopic devices to enhance weight loss. The current method to identify obesity phenotypes is time- consuming, invasive, expensive, and not easily accessible. To address these limitations, in an academic-industry partnership, we developed and validated a novel blood- and saliva-based biomarker test to identify people with the abnormal postprandial satiety phenotype; we propose to study if this biomarker predicts greater weight loss response to semaglutide.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative: Keratoconus is the most common corneal disease often resulting in severe degradation of vision. Corneal crosslinking has proven to be a helpful palliative for keratoconus patients, slowing disease progression. However, cases of regression and a lack of data cast concern on the long-term effects and efficacy of this treatment. Combined with a lack of etiological knowledge of the disease, lack of a recognized animal model, and interest in both palliative and curative treatments from pharmaceutical companies creates a need for an advanced human, 3D in vitro model of the keratoconus cornea.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Manipulation of TORC1 signaling extends lifespan and increases disease resistance but has pleiotropic effects making it critical to understand novel downstream mediators, like pre-mRNA splicing, to better target interventions. The goal of this project is to investigate the mechanisms by which pre-mRNA splicing regulates TORC1 downstream processes including lipid metabolism and the causality for longevity. This work will expand our understanding of RNA homeostasis as a novel paradigm in aging and physiology and ultimately serve as a basis for the design of interventions to promote healthy aging and disease resistance.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Narrative CLN1 disease (Infantile Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinosis, or Infantile Batten Disease) is characterized by progressive intellectual and motor deterioration, frequent seizures, loss of vision, and early death, caused by mutations in CLN1 gene, which codes for the lysosomal enzyme palmitoyl-protein thioesterase-1 (PPT1). Recombinant human PPT1 (rhPPT1) can be used as an enzyme replacement therapy for this ultra-rare disease and will ultimately improve the lives of children and families living with this devastating life-long disease for which there is currently no treatment. In our Phase I SBIR we have demonstrated statistically significant in vivo efficacy of rhPPT1 in mice and sheep, In our Phase II SBIR we have already submitted our preIND with a meeting scheduled for May 2023 and are currently generating GLP protein followed by IND-enabling toxicology studies. In preparation for a future clinical trial, we now propose 1. Production of GMP protein, 2. continue our quality documentation 3. prepare a clinical trial protocol and 4. submit an IND. The financial return on investment for this treatment is the FDA rare pediatric disease priority review voucher currently valued at ~$100M.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
PHR: For this project, we (SPIRIT Club) will develop a post-acute, rehabilitation program for people with a chronic brain injury (CBI). We will build an on-demand, evidence-based, stakeholder- informed pathway that includes virtual fitness programming and educational material for adolescents and adults living with persistent cognitive and physical impairments associated with CBI. This CBI-specific programing will be evaluated using a randomized clinical trial to test its utility as a mechanism to promote physical activity and wellness among CBI survivors.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NURSING RESEARCH
PHR: Project Narrative Maternal mortality and morbidity are serious public health concerns in the United States, particularly among non- Hispanic Black women based on the 2021 CDC report that states that a woman’s risk of maternal mortality is 3- 4 times higher if she is black compared to white. Although there are few healthcare systems that facilitate care coordination, they lack maternal telehealth option necessary to optimize access, while others that provide the telehealth option, lack several integrated features such as training the providers for cultural competency, prescription ordering and delivering, tracking, and rewarding healthy life-style changes. InovCares technology plans to use all these integrated features to evaluate the effectiveness of their patented Health-Tribe platform in pregnant women for generating a health assessment report that identifies risks associated and provides guidance for adopting behavioral changes necessary and assessing maternal mental health with care coordination for better maternal outcomes.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Pregnancy-capable Veterans experience an elevated risk of adverse reproductive health outcomes compared to the civilian population because of a confluence of trauma, combat exposure, and other exposures that may affect health outcomes and the development of comorbid mental, physical, and psychosocial conditions, such as autoimmune conditions. The proposed mixed methods study aims to understand and triangulate the multi- level quality and access barriers to contraceptive care Veterans with autoimmune conditions may experience using three different, rich Veterans Health Administration data sources: electronic health record data, medical record text notes, and qualitative interviews. The results from the proposed research will provide a strong foundation for developing interventions and policies to promote high-quality contraceptive care for a population at high risk of adverse reproductive health outcomes.

IC_NAME: OFFICE OF THE DIRECTOR, NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH
PHR: Narrative Patients with mitochondrial disease experience major issues in diverse organs such as the eye, ear, brain, muscle, and kidney. Understanding how mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) variations contribute to health and disease has been hampered by a lack of effective approaches to generate animal models of these diseases. This proposal is to make a new mtDNA CRISPR-based genome engineering toolkit to develop the first conditional models of mitochondrial disease using the zebrafish.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Project Narrative Positive affective stimuli have been shown to improve therapeutic outcomes in the treatment of generalized anxiety disorders but how positive affective states interact with negative affective emotions to facilitate the compartmentalization, reconsolidation, or extinction of generalized fear-related memories is not clear. We find that a positive reinforcer can prevent, reverse, or facilitate the extinction of a generalized threat memory in a dopamine-dependent manner. We will test whether increased dopamine release in the CeA in response to a positive affective stimulus may be an important neural substrate underlying the ability of positive emotional stimulus to suppress threat generalization.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HUMAN GENOME RESEARCH INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The project aims to develop a robust, molecular profiling tool and a target-enrichment assay for early detection and monitoring of cancer using microRNAs (miRNA), a group of vital small RNA molecules. Claret Bioscience will develop a novel method specifically for miRNA based on a proprietary technology that efficiently generates sequencing libraries from minimally abundant, short, nucleic acids fragments. The resultant next-generation sequencing assay will enable more precise cancer diagnosis by accurately measuring changes in composition and abundance of miRNA in tumor and liquid biopsies and enable novel biomarker discovery and evaluation of newly designed miRNA therapeutics.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative  Legionella pneumophila is a human pathogen that uses multiple effector proteins to inhibit translation within its host cell; however, our knowledge of how and when these proteins function during infection is incomplete. This proposal seeks determine the mechanism for one of these effectors and establish a framework for when the various translation-inhibiting effectors are active during infection. Discoveries stemming from this proposal will increase our understanding of Legionella which may be useful for antibiotic drug design but could also yield new insights into our own cell biology since these effectors undermine fundamental processes within the host cell.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DENTAL & CRANIOFACIAL RESEARCH
PHR: Narrative Periodontal disease affects almost half of Americans 30 years and older. Advanced periodontal disease leads to retraction of the gums from the teeth and ultimately loss of teeth. A key step in progression of periodontitis involves the loss of alveolar bone that provides the underlying support for the tooth. This process involves the bone-degrading cells, whose importance in periodontitis is now recognized. We have identified a novel approach to halt the destruction of bone and to prevent tooth loss.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Calcific aortic valve disease (CAVD), the third leading cause of heart disease, has higher incidence in men than women and that aortic valve calcification may be affected by congenitally bicuspid aortic valve disease and levels of cytokine transforming growth factor beta1. Unfortunately, there is no medical treatment, and without surgery, calcific aortic valve disease leads to death. In this project we will use unique preclinical mouse model of CAVD to determine mechanisms involved in the pathogenesis of CAVD, and test if the natural compound emodin can attenuate and/or reverse aortic valve calcification.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Small cell lung cancer (SCLC) exhibits distinct biological subsets, including strongly neuroendocrine and low neuroendocrine (low-NE) subsets, with recent data linking low-NE SCLC to improved responses to immune checkpoint blockade in patients. Lack of mouse models of low NE-SCLC has been a barrier to progress in the field, which we will overcome using mouse models that overexpress the REST repressor of neural/neuroendocrine state. Our preliminary data also link REST to chemotherapy resistance; we will model low-NE SCLC and test the impact of REST activity on responses to chemotherapy and immune checkpoint blockade.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Project Narrative Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) has unrivaled clinical utility, is non-invasive, and provides extremely high spatial resolution; however, MRIs have one severe limitation: patient motion during an MRI scan diminishes the quality of the resulting images. Despite this fact, motion is not currently monitored during clinical MRI scans. The goal of this application is to complete and commercialize an accurate and non-invasive software-based solution for monitoring and reducing patient motion during brain MRIs.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: Despite widespread recognition of the important functions of RNA modifications, there are no commercially available products that can be used to monitor and image site-specific RNA modifications in cells and tissue samples. We propose to develop novel fluorescence-based methods and reagents for the sequence-specific imaging of RNA modifications. Our methods could become the first standard approach for analyzing RNA modifications in any sample, and will enable researchers to perform fluorescence imaging for RNA modifications in important biological and clinical samples, including brain and cancer samples.

PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Osteoarthritis (OA) is the most common form of arthritis, but no disease-modifying drugs exist. Hence, treatment is limited to pain medication, exercise and weight loss, or ultimately total joint replacement. This project develops imaging genetics approaches based on sensitive image biomarkers to allow for genome-wide association studies (GWAS) across multiple large-scale image datasets with the goal of identifying genes associated with early signs of OA as promising targets for future drug developments.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
ORG_NAME: FOX CHASE CHEMICAL DIVERSITY CENTER, INC
PHR: Our goal is to develop the first approved drug for treating molluscum contagiosum (MC), a viral skin disease that afflicts mainly children and immune-compromised individuals. This drug will be for topical use to specifically target the highly contagious MC virus which causes multiple lesions anywhere on the skin. Importantly, these viral lesions can also occur on the eyelids and affect the conjunctiva of the eye itself. For this latter reason especially, the MC topical must be extremely safe. This MC drug is intended to alleviate the morbidity, physical suffering and psychological distress experienced by millions of children!

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative Therapeutic compound access to the brain is tightly regulated by the blood brain barrier (BBB), severely restricting molecules entering the central nervous system (CNS) via the cerebral circulation – as an alternative drug delivery avenue, access has been attempted via the cerebral spinal fluid (CSF). The EnClear technology overcomes this challenge by delivering CNS drugs directly to target, continuously monitoring CSF flow and pressure dynamics, titrating drug infusion, augmenting flow rate, changing CSF flow direction, and oscillating CSF to hold drug concentration over a target region. The EnClear system will improve the outcomes of patients with neurological disease by delivering needed therapeutics, in a precise personalized manner that overcomes the issue of poor CNS penetration.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SCIENCES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Inorganic arsenic is an environmentally ubiquitous toxin that affects >100 million people worldwide, with health consequences ranging from acute toxicity to cancer. We discovered that arsenic exposure disrupts a key protein and three-dimensional (3-D) structure of the genome via novel “circular RNA” regulatory mechanism, thereby altering normal gene expression and cellular activity. In this project, we will define the molecular mechanism and prove that the arsenic-induced “circular RNA” regulatory switch is responsible for disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The Adult Wellbeing CheckUp (AWC) platform will facilitate wellbeing assessments, referrals, and recommendations of American adults over 65 years of age to age well. AWC leverages an existing wellbeing assessment with probing questions to deliver personalized recommendations and behavior change principles to support the aging network. By personalizing to the context of an individual’s life and utilizing evidence-based behavior change principles, the platform will encourage older adults to take actions to improve their individual and overall wellbeing domains. AWC’s initial customers includes government- and privately-funded organizations and programs, healthcare platforms, and older adults.

PHR: NARRATIVE Pre-term birth babies are typically at greater risks of infections, hyperbilirubinemia and hypoglycemia. At the present time, there is a dearth of volume-sparing technologies for blood analysis which places neonates at risk of blood loss and anemia. The objective of this small business grant application is to develop a volume- sparing technology that will utilize 100 times less blood for analysis compared to gold standard approaches.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CENTER FOR COMPLEMENTARY & INTEGRATIVE HEALTH
PHR: Project Narrative Despite the promise of music and technology-based interventions, there lack mobile applications that are specifically designed for use by caregivers of individuals with ADRD and currently there is no device available that will provide immediate relief with the proper dose of music for agitation or apathetic behaviors accompanied by ADRD. A mobile application will be created specifically for the use by people with ADRD supported by their family caregivers to detect heart rate and movement and will be prompted to trigger auto-play of songs, titrating dose based on physiological reactions. It is expected that the proposed application will extend the evidence-based benefits of music in millions of homes for people living with ADRD as a therapeutic by reducing agitation and depression symptoms, which remain a burden for both individuals with ADRD and their family caregivers.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Congenital heart defects are present in 1.8% of newborns and account for one third of congenital defects, yet 80% of cases have no identifiable causes. This project proposes a high-resolution in vivo imaging approach for quantitative blood flow analysis in the early mouse embryonic cardiovascular system to build the first dynamic volumetric cardiac flow pattern in early embryos, set a platform for functional cardiovascular phenotyping, and study the biomechanical forces that regulate cardiac development. This will provide valuable insight to the role of blood flow in regulating cardiovascular development and allow investigation into the interplay between genetic and biomechanical factors in cardiac development and disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative Although significantly understudied, neuraminidase is a potential component for a universal influenza vaccine, as antibodies raised against its conserved sites are protective against circulating influenza subtypes and those of pandemic potential (e.g., H5, H7). Here we propose structure-guided neuraminidase immunogens to immune- focus toward the conserved catalytic site on neuraminidase as well as experiments to understand how influenza evolves in response to focused anti-neuraminidase immunity. This work will inform next-generation influenza vaccines and guide general strategies to elicit cross-reactive humoral protection against rapidly evolving pathogens.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH CAROLINA AT COLUMBIA
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Maternal-child synchrony describes the ways in which mothers and children impact each other’s social and physiological states, it lays critical groundwork for children’s social development, and it is impacted by contextual factors. Children with fragile X syndrome (FXS) are particularly vulnerable to having disrupted maternal-child respiratory sinus arrythmia (RSA; a marker of cardiac functioning) synchrony due to 1) children with FXS and their mothers experiencing atypical RSA functioning, 2) mothers of children with FXS experiencing elevated mental health challenges, and 3) the clinical status of children with FXS, yet the role of maternal-child RSA synchrony in FXS has not yet been examined and the impact of contextual factors on this RSA synchrony has been neglected. Therefore, this proposed study will investigate the role of contextual factors on maternal-child RSA synchrony in FXS during infancy.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative The parathyroid hormone (PTH)-related protein (PTHrP) is a key paracrine and autocrine regulator of bone formation and remodeling, tooth eruption, mammary gland development, placental calcium ion transport, and the main cause of hypercalcemia and osteolysis in patients with malignancy. The proposed research will investigate a novel component, heparin/heparan sulfate, in PTHrP signaling via its PTH type 1 receptor (PTHR). The findings will advance our fundamental understanding of the key cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying PTHrP signaling that are essential for the development of new therapies targeting PTHrP associated diseases.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: Developing a novel epigenetic regulator as a treatment for opioid use disorder Project Narrative Opioid use disorder (OUD) has been declared a public health emergency almost 5 years ago; and despite the availability of FDA-approved medications, relapse and overdose death rates continue to increase. A major challenge for existing treatments is drug- and cue-related memories that remain, which have been linked to craving-induced relapse. EpiVario has identified ACSS2 as a novel epigenetic regulatory mechanism in drug-related memory and developed proprietary ACSS2 inhibitors with efficacy in different substance use disorders, including OUD, and the funds from this SBIR Phase I will help develop next-generation ACSS2 inhibitors as novel pharmacotherapy for the treatment of OUD through epigenetic regulation of memory re-consolidation.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE This project aims to optimize adherence to dietary self-monitoring, a major determinant of outcomes produced by behavioral obesity treatment, which is recommended as a first-line intervention for cardiovascular disease. We propose to conduct a micro-randomized trial to empirically optimize use of gold standard full dietary self- monitoring and four burden-reducing self-monitoring alternatives over 24 weeks of treatment. The project will produce broadly-applicable self-monitoring recommendations and a highly personalized self-monitoring selection algorithm to improve self-monitoring adherence and weight loss throughout behavioral obesity treatment.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Right heart failure (RHF) is the leading cause of death among patients diagnosed with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH). Consequently, RHF is caused by increased lung arterial resistance and, hence, thickening and blockage of pulmonary arteries. Despite approved therapies to treat PAH, RHF contributes to greater than 50% of patient deaths in this disease. This project aims to open a new field of inquiry of PAH by identifying a novel pathway in arterial cell proliferation in PAH. By extension, new druggable inhibitors are expected to target mediators in this pathway with the goal of mitigating PAH.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ARTHRITIS AND MUSCULOSKELETAL AND SKIN DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative Cell attachment to the basement membrane by integrins is critical to maintain structural integrity of the skin, and disrupting dermoepidermal junctions can lead to epidermolysis bullosa (EB), a fragile skin blistering disease. This research aims to determine how an integrin binding protein, CD151, affects the function of integrin α3β1, both of which are necessary for appropriate epithelial binding to the basement membrane and silencing mutations of either cause EB. A molecular structure of the complex and defining the signaling response of this signaling complex will provide understanding for epidermal adhesion and could be exploited therapeutically to strengthen epidermis attachment in EB and potentially other diseases of the skin.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Narrative Patients who suffer a fracture but have non-osteoporotic BMD present a unique challenge to physicians since they have no way of identifying these patients before a fracture occurs. OsteoProbe was developed to identify patients at risk of bone fragility through a Phase II SBIR grant, private investment, research, and development. Phase II results demonstrate that OsteoProbe is a strong predictor of skeletal fragility in women. This study will expand on the Phase II work to include males, establish OsteoProbe as a better clinical predictor of bone strength at the hip, wrist, and spine compared to DXA; transition OsteoProbe into an optimized configuration for manufacturing and support in the commercial environment; and provide for a new FDA clearance of OsteoProbe as a clinically useful device aimed at addressing the bone quality diagnostic gap in the general population.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE After peripheral artery disease (PAD) progresses to critical limb ischemia (CLI), many patients require a peripheral vascular graft (PVG) to increase blood blow to the affected limbs; however, PVG have failure rates of 20–50% within the first year of surgery, and >60% after 5 years. Unfortunately, no available single solution addresses the three main causes of PVG failure to improve long-term patient outcomes. FreeFlow developed a coating technology to reduce the failure rate of PVG by ameliorating these causes of failure; in this proposal, we will further validate our technology in PVG and complete our path to marketability, with the long-term goal of improving the outcomes of patients with PAD and CLI.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SCIENCES
PHR: Identifier: 1410957 EcoWell- A planet in a plate. NARRATIVE Climate change represents the greatest challenge humanity has faced. The climate issue will require decision making at the population level that will define the trajectory of mankind. However, lack of science literacy has already become a roadblock to mitigation approaches. Climate change education is imperative to combat the growing misinformation surrounding the issue. Yet, environmental science education suffers from a lack of innovative technologies that allow students to do active interrogative analysis of the subject matter. We have developed a complete active learning approach to climate change consisting of novel hardware, supported by a suite of educational kits focused on climate change backed by formal assessment. Using the revolutionary, EcoWell™- A planet in a plate, fully integrated system will allow students to directly compare the impact of small changes in climate parameters on biological endpoints and facilitate the teaching of vital data interpretation skills.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Narrative: Recent clinical reports suggest patients can develop anti-PEG antibody (APA) responses to some PEGylated drugs, which in turn compromise their efficacy and safety. Here, we are developing MM-010 as a safe, cost- effective and readily translatable method to intervene against induction of APA and APA-mediated negative outcomes for PEGylated drugs. If successful, our work will provide a low-cost, generalizable strategy for overcoming PEG-sensitivity for many PEGylated medicines.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Narrative. The U.S. government is urgently seeking therapies to protect against and improve survival from Burkholderia pseudomallei (Bpm) and other intracellular bacteria because of their high lethality, inherent antibiotic resistance, ease of dissemination and potential use as bioterrorism weapons. We will evaluate a novel, engineered protein with enhanced bioavailability and pharmacological properties for its ability to stimulate host innate immunity to protect against lethal Bpm infection. These studies will lead to a broad- spectrum treatment effective against Bpm and many other emerging bacterial, viral, and fungal diseases of great importance to public health and national security.

IC_NAME: OFFICE OF THE DIRECTOR, NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH
PHR: Current microscopes cannot form 3D images with cellular-scale resolution over an area larger than a few square centimeters, which limits the throughput and accuracy of model organism screening methods in neuroscience, toxicology and pharmacology. Ramona Optics aims to create a new micro-camera array microscope platform (MCAM-3D) for parallelized 3D imaging of unconstrained model organisms over an entire well plate area (8x12 cm) at cellular-level detail, allowing scientists for the first time to acquire 3D behavior and morphological data at high throughput. In this project, Ramona Optics Inc. will integrate 3D and a lateral perspective imaging modalities into a single instrument and will produce associated software for automated organism analysis to improve the rigor, efficiency, and translatability of high-content screening experiments.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE With chronic stimulation by tumor antigen, chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T cells enter a state of exhaustion that severely limits their otherwise potent anti-cancer capacity. Epigenetic reprogramming is strongly implicated in CAR T cell exhaustion, and the specific genes regulated by key epigenetic players represent potential actionable targets for modulation in CAR T cells to confer resistance against exhaustion. This proposal aims to create a novel system for inducible global epigenetic gene activation (seTET) as well as introduce the first split-engineered epigenome editors (seEE) for controllable activation of specific genes, and to apply seTET and seEE in a CAR T cell “stress test” to identify relevant gene inhibition targets for overcoming CAR T cell exhaustion, which will guide efforts to improve the efficacy of this immunotherapy.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Postpartum depression (PPD) is a devastating complication of childbirth that can be exacerbated in mothers with infants admitted to the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU). Lack of infant and social connectedness increases PPD risk; however, NICU units are understaffed and ill-equipped to address parental mental health. VoiceLove LLC is developing a novel HIPAA-compliant mobile application that enables expanded family engagement by circumventing barriers to communication by allowing an electronic venue for direct parent- family-provider interaction.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Project Narrative Chronic musculoskeletal pain in older age is common and often leads to lower physical activity in this population; however, some older adults with pain are physically active. This proposal investigates the neural and behavioral measures of motivation that may protect against the detrimental effects of pain on physical activity. The results of this study may help identify modifiable protective factors and inform future targets to promote pain resiliency in older adults.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: There has been a rise in filovirus outbreaks caused by Marburg virus, a relative of Ebola virus most specifically in July 2022 and March 2023. These filovirus outbreaks threaten human life, the world economy, and the healthcare system, therefore the need for a highly effective and safe vaccine against Marburg Virus Disease (MVD) is paramount. In this proposal, we seek to develop a vaccine against MVD comprised of a Marburg glycoprotein component in combination with a safe and novel adjuvant that has shown excellent safety in millions of people during COVID-19 pandemic. The vaccine induces broadly neutralizing antibodies against multiple strains of MARV and showed 100% protection against lethal challenge in small animals. Therefore, we aim to further develop this subunit vaccine as a highly efficacious and safe candidate for protection against a large Marburg outbreak.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE A subset of individuals exhibits resilience to Alzheimer’s disease, as indicated by significant Alzheimer’s disease neuropathology on autopsy despite intact cognition. Underlying pathways that engage this resilience remain largely unknown, making it difficult to develop targeted therapies that harness these naturally-occurring pathways. My goal is to investigate genetic mechanisms of natural resilience, so that we can design strategies that leverage these underlying mechanisms to therapeutically confer resilience to Alzheimer’s disease progression.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HUMAN GENOME RESEARCH INSTITUTE
PHR: The ability to sequence 10 million - 100 million single cells per experiment will enable researchers to develop the next generation of cell therapies to treat cancer with greater efficacy at reduced cost. Existing methods for single cell sequencing do not support throughput beyond 1 million cells per experiment, and alternative approaches to scale single cell sequencing are unsuitable for translational research due to trade-offs in performance and ease-of-use. Sansimeon’s approach uniquely scales single cell sequencing with throughput >100M cells, and our streamlined workflow to sequence cells directly from crude & complex samples (such as whole blood or bone marrow aspirates), with a single-step automated workflow, makes the platform ideally suited for high- throughput translational research applications.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative Artificial Axon Labs Inc. is developing a transformational drug screening platform to discover currently non- existing remyelinating therapies for incurable myelin diseases, with the focus on multiple sclerosis (MS). Although the disease modifying therapies for MS available today can prevent the formation of new inflammatory lesions, they do not stop the progression of neurodegeneration and disability in patients, because they fail to stimulate regeneration of myelin, a process called remyelination. To discover urgently needed remyelinating drugs, we developed entirely novel platform, where we use state-of-the art 3D printed artificial axons, very similar to real biological axons, to directly visualize and quantify myelination in response to compounds in the conditions similar to that in the MS brain. Our Artificial Axons platform provides entirely novel and powerful drug discovery tool, which can deliver remyelination drug candidates with a high therapeutic potential in MS patients.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) is an autoimmune disease in which T cells destroy pancreatic β-cells. Each T cell targets specific antigens via recognition through its T cell antigen receptor (TCR), which must survive thymic selection before it can migrate to the pancreas or other peripheral tissues. With paired TCR and transcriptomic data at single-cell resolution, this project investigates the hypothesis that human leukocyte antigen (HLA) alleles confer risk for T1D via the thymic selection of β-cell-specific TCRs that are predisposed for inflammatory T cell states.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative Chronic pain is the leading cause of disability worldwide and current treatments are ineffective and addictive. UbiquiNaV is an engineered bifunctional protein that enables targeted degradation of an ion channel implicated in human pain conditions – this study aims to evaluate the ability of UbiquiNaV to reduce the excitability of pain- sensing neurons and to reveal the mechanism of this reduction. This study may lead to compounds that enable targeted degradation of peripheral ion channels as novel analgesic agents for non-addictive pain therapy.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE STATEMENT To overcome the “undruggable” protein problem, researchers have turn to drugging mRNAs that translate into these undruggable proteins or non-coding RNAs that regulate the biogenesis of these proteins. Avenues of controlling RNA degradation include induced proximity degradation or splicing modulated nonsense-mediated decay. Early-stage RNA degradation drug discovery has been hindered by current high-throughput screening assay technologies designed for protein targets. Therefore, this project will develop a cell- based assay platform that monitors selected RNA turnover more accurately to accelerate the discovery of small molecule drugs that modulate RNA stability.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The US Monkeypox (MPOX) Epidemic is a public health emergency of international concern which has disproportionately affected gay and other men who have sex with men (MSM) in the United States (US). Testing and pre-exposure prophylaxis for MPOX prevention (e.g., vaccination) promise to be efficacious opportunities to abate the epidemic, but little data exists in the US to describe disparities and barriers to uptake, such as stigma. Using a large cross sectional annual study of approximately 10,000 MSM in the US, the American Men’s Internet Survey, we aim to 1) Evaluate determinants and disparities of MPOX vaccination amongst MSM, 2) Characterize differences in MPOX testing uptake amongst MSM experiencing MPOX-like symptoms, and 3) Develop MPOX-specific stigma measures to evaluate the impacts of MPOX-related stigma amongst MSM.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF BIOMEDICAL IMAGING AND BIOENGINEERING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Malfunctioning of surgical stapling device leading to surgical complications and in few cases to death, is a major cause of concern for their use. RevMedica’s surgical stapling device Cybernetic performs real-time tactile clamping with tissue sensing technology, uses a force sensor and radio frequency identification (RFID) tags to determine optimal stapling parameters. It will decrease the degree of subjective decisions made while suturing and thus will enhance surgeon’s performance

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SCIENCES
PHR: Narrative A Product and chemical testing for the potential to corrode the skin is conducted to ensure correct safety labeling so that individuals can take adequate precautions to avoid injury. This project will develop a new kind of nonanimal, high-throughput, field test to identify dermal corrosives that will improve the capabilities of manufacturers, first responders, and regulators to warn the public about chemicals and products that could potentially damage the skin. Successful development and validation of the new method proposed here will enable early, accurate, on-site warning and thereby reduce the chance of toxic chemical injury as well as potentially open a door to a new way of nonanimal toxicology testing that may be used for other classes of toxins and target tissues in the future.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Bacterial vaginosis (BV) is the most common reason for women in the US to seek medical care for vaginal symptoms resulting in up to 10 million healthcare provider visits annually, however there are few commercially available point-of-care diagnostic options for BV. Detection of small molecule metabolites is one promising diagnostic approach for BV that can eventually be deployed for rapid diagnosis at the point of care. This STTR Phase I proposal seeks to validate promising metabolite biomarkers of BV by assessing their diagnostic performance in a diverse population of women with high prevalence of vaginal symptoms to ensure that representative candidate metabolites are selected for future product development.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
ORG_NAME: WEILL MEDICAL COLL OF CORNELL UNIV
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is a chronic immune-mediated disease that impacts over 3 million Americans, represents a major socio-economic health challenge, and currently has limited preventative, therapeutic or curative treatment strategies. Basic, translational, and clinical studies defined that the pathogenesis of IBD is mediated by a loss of immunologic tolerance to beneficial microbes colonizing the intestine termed microbiota. The focus of this proposal is to delineate a novel pathway that is essential to orchestrate immune tolerance to gut microbiota and restrain intestinal inflammation, as well as explore the pre- clinical therapeutic potential of our findings.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: NARRATIVE “Living medicines” like chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-T cell immunotherapies have led to miraculous cures in aggressive leukemias and lymphomas in children and adults. Since each drug lot serves only one patient, manufacturing and QC testing must be performed individually on every patient sample; however current potency testing platforms are unable to reliably predict clinical outcomes. To solve the need for a more comprehensive CAR-T potency assay, Celldom is developing a platform that combines image-based phenotyping with molecular profiling at the massive scales necessary to measure the ability of CAR-T effector cells to kill their targets, proliferate, and produce molecules necessary to mount a defense against antigen-expressing tumor cells.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: Project Narrative The copper (Cu) homeostasis mechanisms of Candidia albicans are critical for virulence in a human host, which creates niches of Cu-deficiency and excess as part of the immune response. Despite an understanding of the metalloproteins involved in Cu homeostasis, the mechanism of activation of the transcription factor that controls the Cu-deficient response is still unknown. We propose a wide array of biochemical techniques to investigate the location and metalation state of CuZnSod1 and its involvement in activating the transcription factor under Cu-deficient conditions induced by antifungal treatment; these results will advance our understanding of Mac1’s activation in C. albicans under Cu-deficient conditions and inform our understanding of developing better antifungal treatments exploiting metal-specific weaknesses.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative Using an Inclined Plane System to Triage TBI Patients Traumatic brain injury (TBI), such as that experienced in blast injuries and collisions, can vary in severity and be difficult to detect. Mild TBI makes up the majority of brain injuries, but it is the hardest to diagnose; many cases go undiagnosed because these mild brain injuries are not detectable on a CT scan. Further, laboratory diagnostic tests require expensive instrumentation and can take a long time to process and coordinate, making this information difficult to obtain in bedside and emergency situations. We need a point-of-care device that can quickly detect elevated biomarker levels to diagnose and monitor the severity of TBI. To address this need, Hemex Health is proposing to adapt its existing technology combined with micro-engineering methods (microbeads and microfluidic channels) to capture specific TBI biomarkers for identification and monitoring of TBI.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative: This program aims at validating clinically a software to support physicians in percutaneous microwave ablation of liver tumors. In this form of treatment physicians insert a needle-shaped probe in the tissues which applies heat and destroys the malignancy. As physicians do not have a direct view of the tissues, they use images to track the position of the probe in the body, but there are challenges in evaluating from the images which tissues have been killed and which not – a situation that leads to incomplete treatment of the tumor. The software developed in this research program simulates the physics taking place and indicates on images, during the procedure, which part of the tumor has been killed and which not. Availability of this computerized aid should result in a much more consistent treatment of the tumor volume.

PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE  This STTR Phase I project is to develop an MRI-guided, theranostic extracellular vesicle (EV) platform for treating myocardial diseases, such as myocardial infarctions (MI). We anticipate that our innovative theranostic EV platform will emerge as a safe and effective cell-free regenerative therapy with capability for treatment monitoring and response prediction. The successful development of proposed EV platform will open a new horizon for treating various cardiovascular diseases.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Preeclampsia is a devastating pregnancy complication which current prediction algorithms cannot precisely predict. Kanona, Inc is developing a cell-free DNA based algorithm that relies on utilizing placental epigenetic signatures contained within low-pass whole genome sequencing data routinely generated for prenatal aneuploidy screening. This project will refine the current prediction algorithm by correcting for pre-analytical variables, identify relevant epigenetic signatures with placental tissue sequencing and deeper sequencing of cell-free DNA, and perform validation on an external cohort enriched for preeclampsia.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Fragile X-associated tremor/ataxia syndrome (FXTAS) is caused by premutation alleles of the FMR1 gene and defined by deterioration of motor abilities and pathology of the cerebellum. Despite their primary roles in FXTAS, motor abilities and cerebellar processes in FXTAS are understudied, and objective, quantitative approaches for tracking their degeneration are needed to understand key mechanisms and track disease onset and progression. Comparing premutation carriers with FXTAS, premutation carriers without FXTAS, and healthy controls, the proposed studies will characterize cerebellar structural and functional degeneration in FXTAS, their relationships with genetic/molecular causes and clinical decline, and their variation across male and female premutation carriers.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Corneal transplantation rejection in high-risk patients occurs at an alarming rate of 70% within 10 years of the surgery. Bedrock Therapeutics has developed a single dose gene therapy specifically for the corneal donor tissue that prevents high-risk acute rejection in an animal model. The work proposed here in seeks to de-risk this approach for applications in human that require corneal transplantation. Successful application of this approach in the corneas may also prevent rejection of other transplanted organs including heart, liver, lung, and kidney.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Cardiac arrest is the leading cause of death in the United States and other developed countries. In public discussions, these deaths are often called “heart attacks,” but in reality, they most often occur as a result of lethal ventricular arrhythmias. We previously identified unique elements of the electrical circuits that cause these ventricular arrhythmias. We developed a gene therapy catheter that would allow us to target the heart attach skar. This proposal focuses on developing a gene therapy to prevent the unique elements of the electrical circuit from causing ventricular tachycardia, thereby eliminating these arrhythmias.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Hypoparathyroidism is a classic hormone deficiency disorder that does not have a true replacement therapy. Untreated or inadequately treated hypoparathyroidism leads to severe calcium deficiency, which is life- threatening. Extend Biosciences is developing a long-acting hormone replacement therapy that the patient can self-administer at home.

PHR: The goal of this proposal is to continue the development of a novel, non-egg-based, influenza vaccine platform that allows for multiplexed antigen incorporation and produces robust, protective immune responses with less antigen content when compared to current vaccines. IC_NAME: NATIONAL CENTER FOR ADVANCING TRANSLATIONAL SCIENCES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE RNA vaccines and therapeutics have gained a lot of attention following the success of the mRNA-based COVID-19 vaccines and many new companies are entering the field. The sudden need for vast quantities of RNAs to be manufactured is hampered by significant supply chain issues and a lack of expertise. This proposal will result in a new method for manufacturing circular mRNAs using well-established yeast expression systems that aims to reduce the delays and costs associated with manufacturing and simplify purification for downstream applications.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DENTAL & CRANIOFACIAL RESEARCH
PHR: Project Narrative Inflammation of the mouth and esophagus, called oral mucositis, is a common and severe side- effect of chemo- and radiation therapy used in cancer treatment that has significant implications on outcomes and health care costs. Sinopia Biosciences has identified a target that shows efficacy in reducing both the duration and severity of oral mucositis in an established model. This proposal will develop a novel compound for that target for oral mucositis.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CENTER FOR ADVANCING TRANSLATIONAL SCIENCES
PHR: Narrative Breaches in the logistically challenging cold chain infrastructure required for vaccine transport and delivery are overwhelmingly common, leading to wasted, ineffective, or even dangerous vaccines. Current freeze- and spray-drying technologies used to create cold chain-free pharmaceutical formulations are inefficient, energy intensive, and subject biological molecules to harmful drying and temperature stresses. This project will support the continued development of Rapid Room Temperature Aerosol Dehydration (RTAD), a scalable system for continuous dehydration of liquid pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical formulations at short time scales and non-destructive temperatures, providing efficient and effective thermal stabilization of biological drugs.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative The project addresses the need for a lightweight and efficient personal cooling garment to protect at-risk patients from extreme heat waves caused by climate change. We will develop an automated, high-throughput process to manufacture flexible thermoelectric devices and integrate them into a cooling garment. The demonstrated feasibility of scalable manufacturing and benchtop measurements of the cooling performance of the garment prototype will pave the way for further development of the technology towards commercialization.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE: Retinal degeneration is a biological phenomenon that drives the pathology of eye disorders such as age-related macular degeneration, retinitis pigmentosa, and glaucoma. Mitochondrial dysfunction is a major contributor to these degenerative diseases that remains to be more thoroughly investigated. By analyzing specific mechanisms that lead to mitochondrial dysfunction in the retina and retinal pigment epithelium, I hope to better understand disease onset and reveal novel therapeutic targets to improve patient care.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: Therapeutic antibodies have had a profound impact on the treatment of many diseases, but are extremely expensive to produce. Novel materials developed by Bondwell Technologies have the potential to dramatically increase binding capacity in a low-cost, single-use product. The proposed studies will expand efficiency of the membrane filters validated in Phase I and II studies. Membrane efficiency and industrial optimization will allow testing by our established Industry partners.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative Despite the availability of vaccines, outpatient treatments for COVID-19 that can reduce risk of hospitalization, have low risk of drug-drug interactions, and retain activity against any variant of SARS-CoV-2 are sorely needed to mitigate the ongoing economic and public health impacts of COVID-19. In this project, we are seeking to advance an inhaled immunotherapy for COVID-19 based on an antibody-like molecule that can neutralize all ACE2-binding pathogen, including every variant of SARS-CoV-2, trap the virus in airway mucus and facilitate rapid clearance of the virus from the airways. The proposed project would bring this new treatment through all activities required prior to initiation of Phase 1 clinical studies.

PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Dysfunctional sexual behavior, characterized by disturbances in sexual desire, preference, arousal, and orgasm, is a common, burdensome, and costly health condition. IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative TEGA has developed an alternative source of heparin, an essential drug in modern medicine. Currently, heparin supplies are at risk because they rely on vast pig populations in China that can be decimated by disease. Our heparin is produced in recombinant cells in a completely controlled process that eliminates the risk of disease in animal populations. Through additional bioengineering we propose to produce heparin with reduced risks of known side effects. We will also develop a novel manufacturing process to increase production efficiency and reduce costs.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: Narrative This SBIR focuses on developing an optimized combination CBD and THC fixed-dose therapeutic for FDA approval to treat migraine with and without aura, the second most debilitating disease worldwide. This new product will offer an optimally safe and effective cannabinoid combination to treat migraine under FDA oversight, within U.S. federal and international healthcare systems, and enabling careful physician led disease management as an alternative to self-medication with unregulated cannabis.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DENTAL & CRANIOFACIAL RESEARCH
PHR: Project Narrative This application features the construction and RCT-based evaluation of a professional development program and tool, BeReady2Smile_ProD, which will promote oral health behavioral parenting strategies among parents by providing a scalable and sustainable approach for distal training of Parenting Educators using both Home- based and Group-based delivery methodologies. IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Breast cancer lethality is primarily caused by metastasis. However, the genetic and epigenetic mechanisms contributing to metastasis remains unclear. This project aims to dissect network of molecular pathways and to identify epigenetic drivers of metastasis, which will provide a molecular basis for designing precision therapies to improve the survival of triple negative breast cancer patients.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CENTER FOR ADVANCING TRANSLATIONAL SCIENCES
PHR: Project Narrative Due to the health dangers associated with endotoxin contamination, testing via Limulus Amebocyte Lysate (LAL) assays based on the blood extract of endangered horseshoe crabs is critical for pharmaceuticals, biological products, and medical devices. Here, to provide new endotoxin sensors with no requirement for horseshoe crab blood or any of its components, a novel bioluminescent endotoxin detection and quantification assay will be developed using alternative de novo protein endotoxin biosensors. By enabling the development of endotoxin sensing lucCage biosensors, this approach promises sustainable, inexpensive, and robust endotoxin bioassays of high impact in the biotechnology industry.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Project Narrative Erythropoietin (EPO) is a potential treatment for Alzheimer’s disease (AD), however does not cross the blood- brain barrier (BBB), and therefore requires large doses which result in adverse effects. EPO has been modified to enter the brain by binding to the BBB transferrin receptors, and using this approach, EPO can be ferried into the brain non-invasively without the need for high doses. Our recent work shows that this BBB-penetrating EPO is protective in mouse models of AD, and the goal of this proposal is to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and mechanisms of the BBB-penetrating EPO at escalating doses in mouse models of AD.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CENTER FOR COMPLEMENTARY & INTEGRATIVE HEALTH
PHR: Project Narrative The human gut microbiome is a complex community of microbes whose role in human health has only recently begun to be elucidated. Dysbiosis in the gut microbiome is associated with disorders that range from obesity to neurodegeneration to digestive diseases. Our Phase 1 application leverages multiple novel technologies to accelerate the discovery of therapeutically beneficial bacteria that can treat or prevent disease linked to dysbiosis.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Despite improvements in therapy over the last two decades, up to half of all inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) patients are unable to achieve long-term remission with available drugs. Orphagen proposes to develop a novel inhibitor of retinoic acid signaling that blocks the induction of two gut homing molecules on inflammatory T cells, preventing their accumulation in the intestine. Building on the promising preclinical efficacy and safety profile of potent and selective retinoid antagonists discovered at Orphagen, we aim to develop a first-in-class oral drug to alleviate suffering in IBD patients.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Among the estimated 11 million care partners who provide care to persons with Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) and AD-Related Dementias (ADRD), many are tasked with the management of dysphagia (swallowing difficulty) and they experience higher levels of emotional burden, isolation, depression, and hopelessness than their counterparts who do not manage dysphagia. In this Phase I project, we will employ two stages of user-centered design to determine the unique needs of AD/ADRD care partners who manage dysphagia and design an evidence-based intervention for dysphagia management with digital training content and behavioral nudges. Our goal is to commercialize the intervention to help care partners anticipate, avert, and respond to challenges faced with dysphagia management during the course of AD/ADRD and to enhance health and well-being.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Narrative Alzheimer Disease is the most common age-related neurodegenerative disorder. Sporadic late-onset AD represents the majority of cases. The exponentially aging patient population means the healthcare burden will also increase exponentially. In this collaborative proposal, NeuCyte is partnering with UCSF to establish a reproducible, bioluminescence-based screening platform using mini-brain assembled organoids (assembloids) for sporadic late-onset Alzheimer Disease. These assembloids are more representative of the human brain because they can be coaxed into developing Alzheimer, which will allow pharma to test their compounds to identify new AD therapies to address this growing healthcare crisis.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Project Narrative Pathological tau causes neuronal dysfunction and neurodegeneration in tauopathies such as Alzheimer’s disease, frontotemporal lobar degeneration, and corticobasal degeneration. The proposed work investigates potential molecular mechanisms of proteostatic disruption underlying the neurotoxic effects of tau. Successful completion of this work will identify novel therapeutic targets for restoring tau proteostasis to treat tau accumulation and toxicity, with potential for future translational studies.
